page.title: Questions - Embedded Clause Yes/No Questions
page.introduction: Embedded Yes/No questions in English have a question marker or complementizer (whether or if) before the embedded question, which is otherwise the same as a declarative sentence. Other languages may have other ways to signal an embedded Yes/No question. Representative examples of English embedded Yes/No questions include:

EnglishExample.exItem: I wonder whether she will come.
I will know if she goes.
Sue wonders whether the boy could have hit the ball.
